message.content:
We first need to extract the relevant values from the three statements. Below is the step‐by‐step process:

1. Debt to Equity Ratio 
 • From the balance sheet, the only liabilities shown are the “Total Current Liabilities”: 728279.50.
 • The Total Owner’s Equity is 14095371.35.
 • Therefore, the Debt to Equity Ratio = Total Liabilities / Owner’s Equity = 728279.50 / 14095371.35 ≈ 0.0517.
 • Rounding to two decimal places gives approximately 0.05.

2. Net Profit Margin 
 • From the income statement, the Net Profit is 1095371.35 and the Total Revenue is 5565589.48.
 • Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100 = (1095371.35 / 5565589.48) × 100 ≈ 19.68%.
  
3. Return on Assets (ROA) 
 • The ROA is calculated using Net Profit and Total Assets. From the balance sheet, the ending Total Assets are 14823650.85.
 • ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100 = (1095371.35 / 14823650.85) × 100 ≈ 7.39%.

4. Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio 
 • From the balance sheet, the beginning Accounts Receivable was 0.00 (on 2023-12-31) and the ending Accounts Receivable is 1502354.84 (on 2024-01-27). 
 • The average Accounts Receivable = (0.00 + 1502354.84) / 2 = 751177.42.
 • From the income statement, the Main Business Revenue = 5565589.48.
 • Thus, the Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio = Total Revenue / Average Accounts Receivable ≈ 5565589.48 / 751177.42 ≈ 7.41.

Now we present the result in the required JSON format:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.05",
    "Net Profit Margin": "19.68%",
    "Return on Assets (ROA)": "7.39%",
    "Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio": "7.41"
  }
}
